abstract: Many recreational boat owners choose to continue taking to the waters well into their retirement years, but may increasingly find themselves needing to adapt to their growing physical limitations; changes in their routines may include addition of mechanical gadgets that help with tough tasks, taking shorter, safer trips, and even switching to smaller craft.
lead_paragraph: At least two-fifths of owners of recreational boats in the United States are over 50, and while many continue to boat beyond retirement age, they have to adapt to some physical limitations.

headline.main: Deciding When to Trim Sails to Stay on Water
headline.print_headline: Deciding When to Trim Sails to Stay on Water
